alert.note: Alert for Menard (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 15 at 6:49AM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN MENARD COUNTY THROUGH 730 AM CDT... At 647 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles east of Camp Sol Mayer, or 9 miles east of Fort Mckavett, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Menard, Fort Mckavett, The Intersection Of Us- 83 And Ranch Road 1773, Camp Sol Mayer, The Intersection Of Us- 83 And Highway 29, and Us-83 Near The Kimble-Menard County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. To report severe weather, contact your nearest law enforcement agency. They will relay your report to the National Weather Service office in San Angelo.
